blog.name: inikavulpixelreviews
blog.title: Let's Talk About Pokemon!
blog.description:
Reviewing my personal opinion on every single Pokemon! Yes, all 809 of them!
(Mostly) Daily Uploads, 3 PM EST.

title: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Druddigon
body:
621: Druddigon

This rugged-faced dragon is on the unfortunate end of things. It’s a much less conventionally appealing design compared to other dragons, let alone the ones in the same generation. It hardly has any gimmicks other than maybe getting Rough Skin for one of its abilities. And it’s pretty outclassed by most dragon types stats-wise.

But despite all this, I’ve had something of a soft spot for Druddigon. It has a really nice rugged design with a lot of jaggies and spikes, looking even rougher toward that big red face. Most people consider that a point against it, saying it looks dumb or out of place. To which I gotta say, huh? How else are you supposed to make the face of this spiky menace look? Sleek and elegant?

Besides, there’s plenty of real-life lizards that, had they been fictional critters, would often be criticized for having an odd part that’s off-color compared to the rest of them.

Another common criticism to Druddigon is that the wings look janky and unable to lift the thing off the ground. But so far, no official Pokemon media has displayed the thing is able to fly. It doesn’t learn fly, and any official artwork shows the thing more like a land-dweller. And in fact, the Pokedex claims it to be an underground dweller. It’s like an evolutionary leftover from a common, winged ancestor!

Those wings do serve a purpose, in being big solar panels to absorb sunlight to allow the thing to animate. Since it apparently freezes up and remains still during cold nights. Which really calls to mind gargoyles, a common explanation of their origins. Which I’m all-for, but sure am disappointed that doesn’t make the thing a unique Dragon/Rock type.

I also feel like it’s one of those Pokemon where the definitive official artwork doesn’t do it justice as much as say, the TCG artists.

Personal Score: 9/10

Very solid Dragon that isn’t appreciated nearly enough as it should be.

[Archive]

blog.name: omnisregion

blog.description:
The To-do list:

- VOTE in the realistic Omnis Pokemon fanart contest!

- VOTE on Team Equinox Admin Wesley’s Signature Pokemon!

summary: Omnis Ekans Line Hidden Ability Suggestions  Let’s get working on the Omnis Ekans line’s Hidden Ability! Here are some things to...
caption:
Omnis Ekans Line Hidden Ability Suggestions

Let’s get working on the Omnis Ekans line’s Hidden Ability! Here are some things to keep in mind for the Omnis Ekans line when suggesting Abilities:

  • The Omnis Ekans line is a Ghost/Dragon line based on the basilisk and the Lambton Worm
  • They gained their Ghost/Dragon typing due to persecution from humans and Pokemon
  • The Omnis Ekans line is version exclusive with the Ghost/Grass Omnis Natu line (their Abilities are here), so you may want to suggest Abilities that go together

Here are their normal abilities as a reminder:

  • Intimidate: Upon entering battle, the opponent’s Attack lowers one stage.
  • Omnis Ability: Petrify- When a Pokemon with this Ability is sent into battle, it lowers the opponent’s Speed by one stage.

You may suggest up to THREE canon or official Omnis Abilities (except for the ones that are common in Omnis). New fanmade Abilities are permitted, but the community has the right to tweak the Ability if they feel it’s overpowered.

What do you suggest?
